titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jessica Lacher-Feldman

publicationstmt.publisher: The College of Saint Rose Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit2013-11-25T09:34-0500

did.unittitle: Smith, Ursula Rita Casey, Papers

repository.corpname: The College of Saint Rose Archives

physdesc.extent: (3 boxes: 2 smaller boxes in 1 larger box)

did.abstract: This collection consists of materials that we found in Ursula Smith's home upon her passing in early 1999. The collection offers a unique glimpse into the evolution of The College of Saint Rose since its founding in 1920. The collection also illustrates the different aspects of the college that Ursula Smith found important and worth remembering. The collection traces her evolution from Saint Rose Student, to Saint Rose parent, to Saint Rose patroness.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Ursula Rita Casey Smith (1902-1999) was a member of the first graduating class of The College of Saint Rose. Her sister and a member of the Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet, Sister Rita Agnes Casey (1893-1960), was one of the founders of the college. Her daughter, Sister Rose Regina Smith (formerly Maryrose Smith) was the first child of a Saint Rose alumna, graduated in 1950, and has worked at the College of Saint Rose for over twenty years. She also had two other daughters who graduated from the College of Saint Rose: Ann Smith Malloy (class of 1951) and Ursula Smith McKegney (class of 1957). Her husband, Edward "Duke" Smith was among the first men to attend the College of Saint Rose, as part of an evening education program aimed at veterans.

blockquote.p: The Ursula Rita Casey Smith Collection contains the memorabilia and mementos that Ursula felt compelled to hold onto throughout her life. The collection spans several decades and reflects the important role that The College of Saint Rose played in her life.

The collection contains College of Saint Rose memorabilia, photographs, a handmade photo album for Chi Mu Kappa, a sorority created for the members of the first graduating class of the college. The collection also contains newspaper clippings related to the college and its alumni, as well as clippings related to herself, her daughter, Sister Rose Regina Smith, as well as her sister, Sister Rita Agnes Casey. The collection also contains programs from Rose Day events, musical programs and theater productions, and commencement programs from the college. Also within the collection are personal correspondence in the form of greeting cards, as well as letters related to the College of Saint Rose alumni association, and issues surrounding the upheaval at The College of Saint Rose in the late 1960s -early 1970s. Also included in the collection are memorial cards and cards sent to her parents by Sister Rita Agnes Casey.

While the collection is broad in scope and spans many decades, it does not reflect the College of Saint Rose as a whole, but rather aspects of the College of Saint Rose and how the college, in turn, affected the life of one individual. This collection is unique because it belonged to one of the founding students of the College of Saint Rose, a woman who valued her own education as well as the college itself. The collection is also a reflection on the evolution of Catholic college education and the education of women in the 20th century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p:
The collection is organized into the following series:
Newspaper Clippings, 1950-1995
Photographs, 1921-1950s
Saint Rose Publications, 1954-1973
Rose Day Publications, 1943-1957
Textbooks, 1920-1923
Class Notes, 1924
Book Covers, undated
Report Cards, 1920-1923
Tuition Receipts, 1948-1957
Personal Correspondence, 1921-1996
Religious Memorial Cards and Prayer Cards, 1939-1990
Hand-lettered Miniatures, undated
Saint Rose Event Programs, Flyers and Posters, 1922-1995
Commencement Programs and Publications, 1957
The College of Saint Rose College Catalogs, 1920
General Correspondence, 1947-1995
Alumni Association, 1934-1990
Archconfraternity of St. Joseph Norbertine Order, 1979
Diplomas and Awards, 1946 and 1985-1986
Memorabilia, 1926-1995

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions to this collection.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p:
An extensive volume of materials was removed and added to other collections. A list of the items, the series they were taken from, and the collection they were moved to is as follows.
From Series 2: Photographs
Photograph of President Thomas Manion sitting at his desk. The photograph is attached to a paper with the heading, "What do you mean I have to ask the faculty."
Moved to: Photograph Collection

did.unittitle: Newpaper Clippings
Contains newspaper clippings related to The College of Saint Rose, obituaries of Saint Rose alumni and obituaries from Sister Rita Agnes.
Photographs
8"x10" Sepia toned photograph of the Class of 1924. [Signed]
Portrait of Sister Rita Agnes Casey. (Albany Art Union)
b/w photograph often girls at an outdoor party, holding balloons and rackets.
b/w photograph of unidentified woman holding camera in front of a porch
b/w photograph of house and porch
b/w photograph of a group of 18 young women posing outdoors
2 b/w photographs, 2 1/2" x 1 3/4" of six young women dressed in costume, standing outside a building
b/w photograph of young woman standing outside a barn, possibly Ursula Casey Smith
b/w photograph of a bride standing next to a fireplace, possibly Ursula Casey Smith
b/w portrait photograph of young woman, possibly Ursula Casey Smith enclosed in a leather flap. Photographer's studio is Gustave Lorey.
b/w photograph of two members of the Class of 1924 embracing in front of a house
b/w photograph of a young Sister M. Rosaleen Gilroy '24 standing on a wooded path in a heavy coat
First Daughter of an alumna to enter Saint Rose, Maryrose Smith (now Sister Rose Regina Smith) with her mother, Ursula Casey Smith, and Sister
Rita Agnes Casey, sister of Ursula Casey Smith, and Mother Rose of Lima Dolan. (Press Photograph)
cropped portrait of Sister Rita, from Rose Leaves Yearbook with editorial markings on verso.
4 3" x 3" b/w photographs of six alumni from the class of 1924 sitting in a living room at a reunion

portrait of Sister Rita Agnes Casey Undated, b/w photograph of eight elderly individuals participating in an outdoor picnic. "Acme Photograph Co. 235 Myrtle Ave. John J. Keller, Photographer" is stamped on the back.
photocopy of photograph of Ursula and her three daughters and future daughter-in-law. Published in the "Rosetta," Vol. XXVII, No. 4. December, 1962.
six women in a living room. Likely a reunion picture for the class of 1924, Ursula Casey Smith and Sister Rosaire Grewen are present (picture is a torn Polaroid that has been reattached with tape).
Patrick McCarville and Ursula Casey Smith with her husband Ed.
The 'St. Rosers' at our surprise 25th Wedding Anniversary. Six women are pictured including Ursula Casey Smith
8"x10" b/w photograph of Ursula Casey Smith with Sr. Rosaire Grewen ('24), Sr. Rosaleen Gilroy ('24) and Dr. Manion. (Press Photograph)
Polaroid of two women sitting at a table, one may be Ursula Casey Smith. The background includes a table with a class number on it -appears to be a reunion.
color photograph of four CSR alums, including Ursula Casey Smith, Sr. Rosaire Grewen, and possibly Augusta Wolohan. They are attending a CSR function.
8"x10" b/w photograph of Sr. Rose Regina Smith ('50, '90) with Ursula Casey Smith ('24), Alumni Reunion. (Press Photograph)
photograph of Sister Rosaleen, Ursula, and Kiehm (?) standing at an outdoor event
three snapshots of Ursula with President Louis Vaccaro and her husband Ed Smith, Albany Tricentennial Celebration, Albany, New York.
photocopy of large hand, labeled "Garth Joseph! Hand used by Ursula R. Smith '24, who made him a pair of mittens when he first came to Saint Rose."

This brown suede photo album has a leather applique of XMK, Chi Mu Kappa, the sorority of the first class of women from the College of Saint Rose. The album contains assorted snapshots from Ursula Casey's years at the College of Saint Rose.
College of Saint Rose Publications
"Rosaverian." Vol. XVII, No. 12. : Contains partially filled out crossword puzzle on page 3.
"Rosevarian." Vol. XX, No. 2. : Contains column "Senatorial" written by Casey Smith, page 2.
"Rosevarian." Vol. XX, No. 4. : Contains column "Senatorial" written by Casey Smith, page 2.
"Rosevarian." Vol. XXII, No. 1. : Cover has handwritten ink note to Casey Smith from one of her daughters.
"Rosetta." Vol. XXVI, No. 2. : Contains obituary notice and photograph of Casey Smith's sister, Sr. Rita Agnes, C.S.J.
"Rosetta." Vol. XXVI, No. 3. : Cover and last page contain pencil and crayon scribbles. The name "John John Maloy" has been written across the cover.
"Rosetta." Vol. XXVII, No. 4. : Photograph of Casey Smith, her three daughters, and future daughter-in-law at a reunion. Page 3.
"The Newsletter." Vol. 4, No. 1. : Contains a photograph and mention of Casey Smith at a President's Club Party alumni event. Page 5.
"The Newsletter." Vol. 4. No. 4. : A brief mention of the first class of Saint Rose, with Casey Smith included. Page 1.
"Gadfly." Vol. XXXVIII, No. 9. : The cover includes a short article on the history of the college, which includes information about the first class and a photograph.

"Genesis." Vol. XII, No. 1. : Includes the article, "Shades of the Past Illuminate the Future," which includes a column about Casey Smith, a class photograph of her from 1924, and a current photograph of a reunion with former classmates.
Rose Day Publications
Rose Day Program: Ursula Casey Smith's daughter Anne (Class of 1951) was the trainbearer for the Rose Queen
Rose Day Program: The upper right corner has been colored orange and the name "Ann Smith" has been written in black marker and squared in.
Rose Day Program: Casey Smith's daughter Anne played the role of "Sacrifice" during the War of the Roses
Rose Queen Program: Casey Smith's daughter Ursula was a member of the Rose Chain, page 3.
Textbooks
Essentials of Formal Logic. New York: Encyclopedia Press, 1918: Book belonged to Ursula Casey Smith. The book was probably used in a course at Saint Rose by Ursula Casey Smith from 1920-1924.

Selections from the Letters of the Younger Pliny. Edited with notes and introduction by Samuel Ball Plainer. Chicago: Benj. H. Sanborn and Co., 1919. : This book is from The Students' Series of Latin Classics and was probably used in a Latin class. The top of the cover is inscribed "U. Casey. S.R.C. '24" in pencil. The first twenty pages include underlined words and notes in the margins.
Class Notes

Flip notebook with lined pages and brown cover with green edge. The cover is titled "Ursula R. Casey. Greek I." The notebook is full of her English to Greek translations and includes a personal note that was torn from the notebook.
"ARS Poetica." Typed notes in outline form of general rules for poetic composition. [2 pages].
"Latin VI." Typed and numbered list. Appears to be a to-do list of Latin school assignments.
Book Covers

"College of Saint Rose." Orange and white striped book cover with the college symbol in the center. The cover spine has faded to yellow and the back shows a faded picture of the front entrance to the Science Hall. Inside the following is written in ink: Name: "Ursula Smith," Address: "College of St. Rose," Telephone: "Toeber (?) 61." This cover likely belonged to Casey Smith's daughter Ursula, Class of 1957.

Card to Ursula from Marion informing Ursula of Marion's return to college

Birthday card from Sister Rita to her father
Easter card to 'Mother and Papa' from Sister Rita
Hand painted and hand written birthday card (possibly to both parents) from Sister Rita Agnes.
Collection of 14 postcards sent to Ursula and/or her mother from Sister Rita during her trip to Europe with Sister Rosaire
Itinerary for Sister Rita's tour of Europe
Collection of handwritten letter to Ursula and her mother from Sister Rita on her European tour
Letter to Sister Rita from Sister Emily Joseph
Note to Sister Rita from Alice McCullen, thanking her for a telegram
Letter to Sister Rita Agnes from Sister Kathleen, Music Department, Nazareth College of Rochester
New Years Card to Ursula from Sister Grace Margaret
Card to Sister Rita from Sister Rosaire about tribute to Sr. Rita as first music teache
Note on a prayer card to Sister Rita from Helen B. Carey
Christmas card to Sister Rita from Jessie Patterson
Letter to Mr. Van Olinda from Ursula, thanking him for his portrayal of the late Sister Rita in an article in the Times Union
Letter to Sister Rosaleen from Gertrude Killeen, Seismological Laboratory, thanking her for responding to the Christmas card addressed to Sister Rita
Letter to Urt from Sister Rosaleen
Card from Sandra McLaughlin (Class of 1959), Chairman of the Grand Project to Ursula, regarding her contribution to the Grand [Piano] Project
Letter from Sister Dorothy Flood (Chairman of the Music Department) announcing the purchase of a concert grand piano dedicated in memory of Sister Rita
Card from Mark Sullivan to Sister Rose
Undated, card from [illegible] to 'Urt'.
Undated, letter to 'Marion' from Anne V. Carey re: 'Urt's Latest Edition'
Card sent in congratulations of a new baby from the Alumnae Association of the College of Saint Rose
Easter card to [illegible] from Sister Rita Agnes
Card to Ursula and her mother (Mrs. Casey) from Sister Catherine Francis, thanking them for remembrance of her silver jubilee

College of Saint Rose, Silver Jubilee Greetings Prayer Card
Hand-lettered Miniatures
Hand lettered and water colored miniature, thank you prayer. (This miniature was removed from a small frame for preservation purposes) Unsigned, undated, attributed to Sister Rosaleen Gilroy.

Handlettered and watercolored miniature of The College of Saint Rose's alma mater, 1924-1949, undated.) (This miniature was removed from a small frame for preservation purposes.) Unsigned, undated, attributed to Sister Rosaleen Gilroy.
College Event Programs, Flyers, and Posters
Recital Program: Miss Ursula R. Casey is listed
"Musicale" program: Miss Ursula R. Casey is listed
"Saint Rose Card Party." Sponsored by Saint Rose Mothers: Mrs. Edward Smith is listed under the Tickets Committee.
Golden Roses Liturgy Program: Ursula's nametag is attached to the back of the program.
"Founders' Day Liturgy": Ursula Casey Smith is listed as a yearbook bearer, representing the 1920s.
Annual Spring Concert, Flier with personal note from Daniel DeMarer.
Commencement Programs and Publications
Class Night Exercises: Class of Casey Smith's daughter Ursula, whose name is included in the exercise.

College of Saint Rose Commencement Exercises Program [with Act of Consecration and Act of Responsibility Prayer insert]: Class of Casey Smith's daughter Ursula, whose name is included in the program under Bachelor of Arts.
College of Saint Rose Commencement Invitation and Envelope: Invitation to daughter Ursula's ceremony. Invitation includes personalized card, which is printed "Ursula R. Smith."
Course Catalog

This original college catalog contains information about the foundation of the school, its location, and advantages. Also included are requirements for the Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Science degrees, as well as admission requirements, general information, and information regarding tuition and expenses.
General Correspondence
Letter to Graduates from Dean Sister Rose of Lima regarding future financial assistance
Letter to students from Dean Sister Rose of Lima, welcoming them to the college (likely Maryrose's letter)
Letter to Saint Rose students, parents, and friends, from Sister Catherine Francis, re: Tuition Increase
Letter to Class of 1924 fro Sister Catherine Francis inviting them to visit the renovated campus
Tuition Bill for Ursula Smith Jr.
Letter to "Urt" from Sister Catherine Francis for her remembrance to the College.
Letter from Marie Cullen to Ursula Casey Smith re: welcoming "Urt" into the Yellow Circle of the Alumni Fund
Letter to 'Graduates and friends of Saint Rose' re: co-education at the undergraduate level and a possible name change for The College of Saint Rose
Letter from President Sister Margaret M. Keeshan CSJ re: coeducation
Letter from the office of the President to contributors to Saint Rose
Letter from President Sister Margaret Keeshan CSJ re: donation to the 1968-1969 alumni fund
Letter to Ursula from Sister Margaret Frances Kelly, Chairman of the Fiftieth Anniversary Committee regarding the CSR Anniversary Engagement Calendar
Letter to Ursula from Sister Margaret Frances Kelly, regarding a commemorative convocation and inauguration of President Miele
Letter from President Miele regarding physical facilities changes at the college
Letter to Ursula from President Miele regarding contributions to the annual fund drives
Letter from Thomas A. Manion to Ursula Smith re: recipient of the Sister Rita Agnes Casey scholarship in Music
Letter to Ursula from Mary Murabito, Director of Alumni and Parent Relations about the Founder's Day Liturgy
Saint Rose Alumni Association
Booklet, "Tenth Anniversary of the Class of '24." The cover says "Urt Casey Smith."
Program, "Silver Jubilee Dinner Commemorating the Twenty-fifth Anniversary of the Founding of The College of Saint Rose." Includes signatures of attendees.
Alumnae Association Full Tuition Scholarship, 1948-1952, in honor of Sister Rita Agnes
College of Saint Rose Alumnae Association Annual Dues notice: addressed to Mrs. Smith with her 1959 dues
"The Power of .04%": booklet from the Office of the President regarding financial support. Handwritten note written in pencil on the back cover.
"Rosetta." Vol. XXIII. No. 3.: birth announcement on page 5 for the granddaughter of Casey Smith, and daughter of Ursula Smith McKegney
“St. Rose Alumni News," Vol. 1, No. 2: photograph on page 2 of Casey Smith and classmates at the inauguration of President Miele.
"The Newsletter," Vol. 3, No. 3: Casey Smith is listed as a donor on page 4 and 5. Ursula Smith McKegney on page 6.
College of Saint Rose Alumni Directory and Constitution and By-Laws: notes on pages 54 and 69.
"CSR Update." Vol. I, No. 1: Ursula Smith listed as Phonothon participant on page 7.
"CSR Update." IV, No. 2. Donor Recognition Issue: Casey Smith mentioned on pages 11, 15, and 25. Ursula Smith McKegney mentioned on page 18
Golden Roses Society Lifetime Membership card for Ursula Casey Smith, awarded in recognition of 50 years as an alumna Letter
Archconfraternity of St. Joseph Norbertine Order
Informational Pamphlet "The Archconfraternity of St. Joseph and the Norbertine Order"
Brochure - St. Norbert Abbey
Diplomas and Awards
Delta Epsilon Sigma, Honor of Membership Certificate, Awarded to Sister Rita Agnes
College of Saint Rose Founders' Club: Awarded to Ursula R. Smith
College of Saint Rose Founders' Club: Awarded to Ursula R. Smith
Saint Rose Memorabilia
Two drinking glasses, "75 1920-1995. The College of Saint Rose, 75 Years of Distinction" in blue print.
Two drinking glasses, "College of Saint Rose" with college seal, all in yellow print.

Dance card, "College of Saint Rose Alumnae Informal Dance 1926 Auditorium October twenty-second." Five-sided black booklet on a yellow tassel. The card has five names listed and likely belonged to Ursula Casey Smith.
Dance card, "CSR Sophomore Soiree '51." The booklet is rectangular and attached to a blue tassel. There are seven names listed.
Dance booklet, "Junior Promenade, Class of 1927." The square booklet has a red leather cover and pages for each girl in the class to leave notes. Some pages are filled out.

Dance booklet, "College of Saint Rose Class of 1951 Senior Ball." Booklet is rectangular with a shiny green cover with the college seal, and is attached to a silver string and foam backing. Anne Smith is listed as a committee member and Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Smith as patrons.
Dance booklet, "Junior Prom - 1948 College of St. Rose." Small rectangular booklet with plastic faux pearl cover with gold writing. Attached to a white tassel.
Dance booklet, "Junior Promenade Class of 1928." The booklet is badge-shaped and has a blue-swirled hard cover with a white tassel.
Tickets (2), pink, "Reserved Seat: Rose Day College of Saint Rose."
Name card, rectangular. "Ursula Casey Smith, Silver Jubilee of the Class of '24." White with black writing and silver flowers and trim.

Playing card container, blue-gray leather container labeled "Bridge" with the college seal in gold writing. The container holds two decks of cards, one blue with a Roman figure and one pink with black and silver designs.
Collection of book plates, "Ex Libris Ursula R. Casey," wrapped with a blue band labeled "Sr. Rose."
"CSR Hooked on Swing" wine glasses (2). Glass with red writing, [ca. mid 1980s]
"College of Saint Rose Inaugural Ball." Plastic mug.
Dance Favor(Reddish vinyl box with St. Rose crest, lined with velvet.)
Plastic Keepsake from Inaugural Celebration (dried flowers in plastic pod).
Glass Dish, "Picotte Hall, The College of Saint Rose, September 21, 1977, Dedicated Albany, New York." Gold and white on textured glass.
Button, "Congrads Dr. Mom"
Button (photograph) Dr. Manion.
Button (name tag), "Sr. Rose. Celebrate CSR"
Graduation Tassel, burgundy and cream, Class of 1951 (belonging to Anne nee Smith, daughter of Ursula Casey Smith.
Graduation Tassel, black (possibly Ursula's)
Graduation Tassel, gold and white (probably belonging to Urt's daughters Sr. Rose or Ursula)
Graduation Tassel, gold and white (probably belonging to Urt's daughters Sr. Rose or Ursula)
Pins (2), "Golden Roses, College of St. Rose, 50 Yrs."
Pin, "CSR." Cream colored with gold writing and trim.
Pin, wooden letters spell "St. Rose" with yellow and white ribbons attached to the bottom.
Pin, "May Day 1957." White with blue writing and white and blue ribbons attached to the bottom.
Charm, College of Saint Rose crest. Black with gold edges, possibly a worn on a necklace.

Plastic tube from the 75th Anniversary celebration of Saint Rose, with rolled document inside: "Please accept this seedling as an expression of our appreciation for your continuing commitment to The College of Saint Rose." Also includes instructions for planting the Blue Spruce seeding.
Button (name tag), "Sr. Rose. Saint Rose Night, September 17, 1993." NOTE: Item not found during last inventory (3/3/2004)
